org.apache.mesos.scheduler.plan.strategy

Class InterruptableStrategy<C extends Element>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.mesos.scheduler.plan.strategy.InterruptableStrategy<C>
  • Type Parameters:
    C - is the type of Elements to which the Strategy applies.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Strategy<C>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DependencyStrategy, ParallelStrategy, RandomStrategy, SerialStrategy

    public abstract class InterruptableStrategy<C extends Element>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Strategy<C>
    This class provides an encapsulation of common implementations for the methods associated with pausing and resuming strategies.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InterruptableStrategy() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void interrupt()
      A call to interrupt indicates to a Strategy that it should not produce Elements when Strategy.getCandidates(Element, Collection) is called.
      boolean isInterrupted()
      Indicates whether a Strategy is interrupted or not.
      void proceed()
      If a Strategy is interrupted this should now allow a Strategy to produce candidates on calls to Strategy.getCandidates(Element, Collection).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • Methods inherited from interface org.apache.mesos.scheduler.plan.strategy.Strategy

        getCandidates

    • Constructor Detail

      • InterruptableStrategy

        public InterruptableStrategy()

    • Method Detail

      • interrupt

        public void interrupt()
        Description copied from interface: Strategy
        A call to interrupt indicates to a Strategy that it should not produce Elements when Strategy.getCandidates(Element, Collection) is called. If a Strategy is already interrupted, this should have no effect.
        Specified by:
        interrupt in interface Strategy<C extends Element>

      • proceed

        public void proceed()
        Description copied from interface: Strategy
        If a Strategy is interrupted this should now allow a Strategy to produce candidates on calls to Strategy.getCandidates(Element, Collection). If the Strategy was already interrupted a call to proceed should have no effect.
        Specified by:
        proceed in interface Strategy<C extends Element>

      • isInterrupted

        public boolean isInterrupted()
        Description copied from interface: Strategy
        Indicates whether a Strategy is interrupted or not.
        Specified by:
        isInterrupted in interface Strategy<C extends Element>
        Returns:
        true if a Strategy is interrupted, false otherwise.
